portabout.para: NetBSD/sun2 is the port of NetBSD to the Sun Microsystems sun2 series of computers, which are based on the Motorola 68010 CPU with a Sun-designed custom MMU. Sun sold these computers as both servers and desktop workstations from the early to mid 1980's. They were superseded by the sun3 systems, which are supported by NetBSD as NetBSD/sun3.
Matt Fredette is the maintainer of NetBSD/sun2.

portinfo.portlinkitem: NetBSD/sun3 is NetBSD's port to Sun's 68020 and 68030 based machines
The Machine Emulator (tme) can emulate a Sun 2/120 running NetBSD.

portnews.portnewsitem: NetBSD 4.0 has been released. More information is available in the 4.0 release announcement.

NetBSD 3.1, the first maintenance release of the netbsd-3 release branch, has been released with binary distributions for 53 architectures. More information is available in the 3.1 release announcement.
NetBSD 3.0 released with support for 57 architectures. More information is available in the 3.0 release announcement.
A new driver for the 3Com 3c400 Multibus Ethernet card is available, &man.ec.4;.
Matthew Fredette, the NetBSD/sun2 port maintainer, has added instructions on netbooting NetBSD/sun2 to the NetBSD Diskless HOWTO.
NetBSD/sun2 now has a port page on www.NetBSD.org.
